title: About KBG
mission: To empower students at IIT Mandi with skills at the intersection of biology and AI.
history: Founded as a student initiative to bring together biology and computation enthusiasts.
aboutLong: KBG (Computational Biology Group) started as a small study circle and rapidly grew into a campus-wide community. Over the years we have hosted intensive hands-on workshops, mentored multi-disciplinary student projects, and collaborated with faculty and industry partners to expose students to cutting-edge research at the intersection of biology, data science and machine learning. Our events emphasize reproducible research, open-source tools, and responsible AI practices in life sciences.

features.title: Workshops
features.description: Multi-day, hands-on workshops that cover topics such as molecular modeling, bioinformatics pipelines, ML for sequence analysis, and single-cell analysis. Sessions include lectures, guided labs and capstone mini-projects.

features.title: Projects
features.description: Student-led projects in collaboration with labs and startups. These projects span data visualization, algorithm development, model interpretability in biology, and building reproducible analysis pipelines.

features.title: Speaker Sessions
features.description: Invited talks by academic and industry experts who share recent advances, practical workflows, and career advice for computational biology.

features.title: Community Meetups
features.description: Regular meetups for demos, lightning talks, collaboration matches and social events to grow the community and cross-pollinate ideas.

contact.location: A6 Innovation Lab, IIT Mandi, Himachal Pradesh
